definition: (of a commanding officer) to keep watch/to oversee
to sit/to take a seat/to take (a bus, airplane etc)/to bear fruit/variant of 座[zuo4]
to press down/to calm/to subdue/to suppress/to guard/garrison/small town/to cool or chill (food or drinks)

sentences.english: Marshalled by Ferdinand and Wes Brown, however, United's defence rarely creaked under the Latics' pressure.
sentences.chinese: 由于有费迪南德和布朗坐镇，曼联的防线还算稳固。

sentences.english: He's just used to being in command and telling his story.
sentences.chinese: 他太习惯于坐镇指挥，自说自话。

sentences.english: Lam in an hin, monitoring and big sister set with season always try her.
sentences.chinese: 月娥坐镇一扇轩，监视大妹并设局试她与季常。

sentences.english: Marius posted himself on the lookout upon the crest of the barricade.
sentences.chinese: 马吕斯于是坐镇在街垒顶上警戒着。

sentences.english: And against Tottenham and Manchester City, you want him in the midfield.
sentences.chinese: 之后迎战托特纳姆热刺和曼城，你希望他能坐镇中场。

sentences.english: The enormous barricade felt him on its haunches.
sentences.chinese: 那庞大的街垒感到他坐镇在它的臀部。

sentences.english: Maniche replaced him, going into holding midfield with Essien switching to left-back.
sentences.chinese: 马尼切替补上场，他坐镇中路而埃辛临时客串左后卫。

sentences.english: In the course of the investigation, the PUC charge related to the leadership of basaltic sub-command.
sentences.chinese: 在侦查过程中，市局相关领导亲自坐镇玄武分局指挥。

definition: to defeat decisively/to win decisively/great victory/triumph
to bring up the rear/to provide support/to hold the lines
to pit oneself against sb/to compete with sb/contest/battle/to haggle/to quibble
to live somewhere as a visitor/to stay with sb as a guest/to sojourn
to start a war/to make war/to battle against
to be a guest or visitor
